nodes.name: ReadCSV
nodes.description: It reads in CSV files and creates a DataFrame from it
nodes.details: This node reads CSV files and creates a DataFrame from it.
nodes.hint: Whenever the file is changed, Refresh the Schema

fields.name: storageLevel

fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: path
fields.title: Path
fields.description: Path of the Text file/directory

fields.name: separator
fields.title: Separator
fields.description: CSV Separator

fields.name: header
fields.title: Header
fields.description: Does the file have a header row

fields.name: dropMalformed
fields.title: Drop Malformed
fields.description: Whether to drop Malformed records or error

fields.name: outputColNames
fields.title: Column Names for the CSV
fields.description: New Output Columns of the SQL

fields.name: outputColTypes
fields.title: Column Types for the CSV
fields.description: Data Type of the Output Columns

fields.name: outputColFormats
fields.title: Column Formats for the CSV
fields.description: Format of the Output Columns

nodes.name: Split With Stratified Sampling
nodes.description: This node splits the incoming DataFrame into 2. It takes in the fraction to use in splitting the data by Stratified Sampling.
nodes.details:
Split With Stratified Sampling, which is the preferred way to sample from populations with varing subpopulation sizes.

Returns a stratified sample without replacement based on the fraction given on each stratum.

More details are available at : spark.apache.org/docs/latest/api/python/_modules/pyspark/sql/dataframe.html#DataFrame.sampleBy

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: keyInputCol
fields.title: Column Name
fields.description: column that defines strata

fields.name: fraction
fields.title: Fraction
fields.description: sampling fraction for each stratum. If a stratum is not specified, we treat its fraction as zero

fields.name: seed
fields.title: Seed
fields.description: random seed

nodes.name: UnionAll
nodes.description: This node creates a new DataFrame by merging all the rows without removing the duplicates

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

nodes.name: Split By Expression
nodes.description: This node splits the incoming DataFrame into two output DataFrames by applying the conditional logic

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: conditionExpr
fields.title: Conditional Expression to split the Data on
fields.description: Conditional Expression to be used for Splitting the DataFrame into two. DataFrame which matches the condition will go to the lower edge output. The other would go to the higher edge output.

nodes.name: H2ONeuralNetwork
nodes.description: H2O Deep Learning is based on a multi-layer feedforward artificial neural network that is trained with stochastic gradient descent using back-propagation.
nodes.details:
H2Oâ€™s Deep Learning is based on a multi-layer feedforward artificial neural network that is trained with stochastic gradient descent using back-propagation. The network can contain a large number of hidden layers consisting of neurons with tanh, rectifier, and maxout activation functions.

More details are available at : docs.h2o.ai/h2o/latest-stable/h2o-docs/data-science/deep-learning.html

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: isResponseIsCategorical
fields.title: Is Response Col Categorical
fields.description: it Specify a response column type(numeric or categorical). Separates the Classification and Regression

fields.name: activation
fields.title: Activation
fields.description: Specify the activation function (Tanh, Tanh with dropout, Rectifier, Rectifier with dropout, Maxout, Maxout with dropout), (Maxout is not supported when autoencoder is enabled)

fields.name: average_activation
fields.title: Average activation
fields.description: Specify the average activation for the sparse autoencoder ( average_activation value must be positive)

fields.name: reconstructionMSE
fields.title: Reconstruction MSE
fields.description: Only for AutoEncoder Deep Learning model to get MSE

fields.name: offset_column
fields.title: Offset Column
fields.description: Specify a column to use as the offset (Applicable for regression only)

fields.name: weights_column
fields.title: Weights Column
fields.description: Specify a column to use for the observation weights, which are used for bias correction (The specified weights_column must be included in the specified training_frame)

fields.name: ignore_const_cols
fields.title: Ignore Const Columns
fields.description: Specify whether to ignore constant training columns

fields.name: ignored_columns
fields.title: Ignored Columns
fields.description: Specify the column or columns to be excluded from the model (Optional, Python and Flow only)

fields.name: autoencoder
fields.title: Autoencoder
fields.description: Specify whether to enable the Deep Learning autoencoder (Cross-validation is not supported when autoencoder is enabled)

fields.name: hidden
fields.title: Hidden
fields.description: Specify the hidden layer sizes (value must be positive)

fields.name: hidden_dropout_ratios
fields.title: Hidden dropout ratios
fields.description: Specify the hidden layer dropout ratio to improve generalization (Applicable only if the activation type is TanhWithDropout, RectifierWithDropout, or MaxoutWithDropout)

fields.name: nfolds
fields.title: NFolds
fields.description: Specify the number of folds for cross-validation (Cross-validation is not supported when autoencoder is enabled)

fields.name: fold_assignment
fields.title: Fold Assignment
fields.description: Specify the cross-validation fold assignment scheme (Applicable only if a value for nfolds is specified and fold_column is not specified)

fields.name: fold_column
fields.title: Fold Column
fields.description: Specify the column that contains the cross-validation fold index assignment per observation

fields.name: l1
fields.title: L1
fields.description: Specify the L1 regularization to add stability and improve generalization (sets the value of many weights to 0)

fields.name: l2
fields.title: L2
fields.description: Specify the L2 regularization to add stability and improve generalization (sets the value of many weights to smaller values)

fields.name: seed
fields.title: Seed
fields.description: Specify the random number generator (RNG) seed for algorithm components dependent on randomization

fields.name: adaptive_rate
fields.title: Adaptive rate
fields.description: Specify whether to enable the adaptive learning rate (ADADELTA), (enabled by default)

fields.name: huber_alpha
fields.title: Huber alpha
fields.description: Specify the desired quantile for Huber/M-regression (the threshold between quadratic and linear loss)

fields.name: quantile_alpha
fields.title: Quantile alpha
fields.description: Specify the quantile to be used for Quantile Regression (Only applicable if distribution=quantile)

fields.name: tweedie_power
fields.title: Tweedie power
fields.description: Specify the Tweedie power (Only applicable if distribution=tweedie)

fields.name: balance_classes
fields.title: Balance classes
fields.description: Specify whether to oversample the minority classes to balance the class distribution (Applicable for classification only)

fields.name: categorical_encoding
fields.title: Categorical encoding
fields.description: Specify one of the various encoding schemes for handling categorical features

fields.name: class_sampling_factors
fields.title: Class sampling factors
fields.description: Specify the per-class (in lexicographical order) over/under-sampling ratios (Applicable only for classification and when balance_classes is enabled)

fields.name: col_major
fields.title: Col major
fields.description: Specify whether to use a column major weight matrix for the input layer

fields.name: diagnostics
fields.title: Diagnostics
fields.description: Specify whether to compute the variable importances for input features (using the Gedeon method)

fields.name: distribution
fields.title: Distribution
fields.description: Specify the distribution (i.e., the loss function)

fields.name: epochs
fields.title: Epochs
fields.description: Specify the number of times to iterate (stream) the dataset ( value can be a fraction)

fields.name: elastic_averaging
fields.title: Elastic averaging
fields.description: Specify whether to enable elastic averaging between computing nodes, which can improve distributed model convergence

fields.name: elastic_averaging_moving_rate
fields.title: Elastic averaging moving rate
fields.description: Specify the moving rate for elastic averaging (option is only available if elastic_averaging=True)

fields.name: elastic_averaging_regularization
fields.title: Elastic averaging regularization
fields.description: Specify the elastic averaging regularization strength (option is only available if elastic_averaging=True)

fields.name: epsilon
fields.title: Epsilon
fields.description: Specify the adaptive learning rate time smoothing factor to avoid dividing by zero (Applicable only if adaptive_rate is enabled)

fields.name: export_weights_and_biases
fields.title: Export weights and biases
fields.description: Specify whether to export the neural network weights and biases as H2O frames

fields.name: force_load_balance
fields.title: Force load balance
fields.description: Specify whether to force extra load balancing to increase training speed for small datasets and use all cores (option is enabled by default)

fields.name: input_drop_ratio
fields.title: Input drop ratio
fields.description: Specify the input layer dropout ratio to improve generalization (Suggested values are 0.1 or 0.2)

fields.name: initial_weight_distribution
fields.title: Initial weight distribution
fields.description: Specify the initial weight distribution (Uniform Adaptive, Uniform, or Normal)

fields.name: initial_weight_scale
fields.title: Initial weight scale
fields.description: Specify the scale of the distribution function (Applicable only if initial_weight_distribution is Uniform or Normal)

fields.name: keep_cross_validation_predictions
fields.title: Keep CV Predictions
fields.description: Enable to keep the cross-validation predictions

fields.name: keep_cross_validation_fold_assignment
fields.title: Keep CV Fold Assignment
fields.description: Enable to preserve the cross-validation fold assignment

fields.name: loss
fields.title: Loss
fields.description: Specify the loss function (Use Absolute, Quadratic, or Huber for regression, Use Absolute, Quadratic, Huber, or CrossEntropy for classification)

fields.name: max_after_balance_size
fields.title: MAx after balance size
fields.description: Specify the maximum relative size of the training data after balancing class counts (balance_classes must be enabled)

fields.name: max_runtime_secs
fields.title: Max runtime secs
fields.description: Allowed runtime in seconds for model training

fields.name: max_w2
fields.title: Max w2
fields.description: Specify the constraint for the squared sum of the incoming weights per unit

fields.name: mini_batch_size
fields.title: Mini batch size
fields.description: Specify a value for the mini-batch size. (Smaller values lead to a better fit; larger values can speed up and generalize better)

fields.name: missing_values_handling
fields.title: Missing values handling
fields.description: Specify how to handle missing values (Skip or MeanImputation)

fields.name: momentum_start
fields.title: Momentum Start
fields.description: Specify the initial momentum at the beginning of training; we suggest 0.5 (Applicable only if adaptive_rate is disabled)

fields.name: momentum_stable
fields.title: Momentum Stable
fields.description: Specify the final momentum after the ramp is over; we suggest 0.99 (Applicable only if adaptive_rate is disabled)

fields.name: max_categorical_features
fields.title: NFolds
fields.description: Specify the maximum number of categorical features enforced via hashing (value must be at least one)

fields.name: fast_mode
fields.title: Fast mode
fields.description: Specify whether to enable fast mode, a minor approximation in back-propagation (option is enabled by default)

fields.name: quiet_mode
fields.title: Quiet mode
fields.description: Specify whether to display less output in the standard output ( not enabled by default)

fields.name: single_node_mode
fields.title: Single node mode
fields.description: Specify whether to run on a single node for fine-tuning of model parameters

fields.name: nesterov_accelerated_gradient
fields.title: Nesterov Accelerated Gradient
fields.description: Enables the Nesterov Accelerated Gradient (Applicable only if adaptive_rate is disabled)

fields.name: overwrite_with_best_model
fields.title: Overwrite with best model
fields.description: Specify whether to overwrite the final model with the best model found during training, based on the option specified for stopping_metric

fields.name: rate
fields.title: Rate
fields.description: Specify the learning rate (Applicable only if adaptive_rate is disabled)

fields.name: rate_annealing
fields.title: Rate Annealing
fields.description: Specify the rate annealing value (Applicable only if adaptive_rate is disabled)

fields.name: reproducible
fields.title: Reproducible
fields.description: Specify whether to force reproducibility on small data

fields.name: rho
fields.title: Rho
fields.description: Specify the adaptive learning rate time decay factor (Applicable only if adaptive_rate is enabled)

fields.name: standardize
fields.title: Standardize
fields.description: If enabled, automatically standardize the data (mean 0, variance 1)

fields.name: stopping_metric
fields.title: Stopping metric
fields.description: Specify the metric to use for early stopping

fields.name: stopping_rounds
fields.title: Stopping Rounds
fields.description: Stops training when the option selected for stopping_metric doesnâ€™t improve for the specified number of training rounds, based on a simple moving average

fields.name: stopping_tolerance
fields.title: Stopping tolerance
fields.description: Specify the relative tolerance for the metric-based stopping to stop training if the improvement is less than this value

fields.name: score_duty_cycle
fields.title: Score duty cycle
fields.description: Specify the maximum duty cycle fraction forscoring

fields.name: score_each_iteration
fields.title: Score Each Iteration
fields.description: Specify whether to score during each iteration of the model training (Optional)

fields.name: score_interval
fields.title: Score interval
fields.description: Specify the shortest time interval (in seconds) to wait between model scoring

fields.name: score_training_samples
fields.title: Score training samples
fields.description: Specify the number of training set samples for scoring. The value must be >= 0

fields.name: score_validation_samples
fields.title: Score validation samples
fields.description: Specify the number of validation set samples for scoring (Applicable only if a validation_frame is specified)

fields.name: score_validation_sampling
fields.title: Score validation sampling
fields.description: Specify the method used to sample validation dataset for scoring

fields.name: classification_stop
fields.title: Classification stop
fields.description: Specify the stopping criteria in terms of classification error (1-accuracy) on the training data scoring dataset

fields.name: regression_stop
fields.title: Regression stop
fields.description: Specify the stopping criterion for regression error (MSE) on the training data (Regression models only)

fields.name: sparse
fields.title: Sparse
fields.description: Specify whether to enable sparse data handling, which is more efficient for data with many zero values

fields.name: sparsity_beta
fields.title: Sparsity beta
fields.description: Specify the sparsity-based regularization optimization (Applicable only if autoencoder is enabled)

fields.name: replicate_training_data
fields.title: Replicate training data
fields.description: Specify whether to replicate the entire training dataset onto every node for faster training on small datasets

fields.name: shuffle_training_data
fields.title: Shuffle training data
fields.description: Specify whether to shuffle the training data

fields.name: target_ratio_comm_to_comp
fields.title: Target ratio comm to comp
fields.description: Specify the target ratio of communication overhead to computation

fields.name: train_samples_per_iteration
fields.title: Train samples per iteration
fields.description: Specify the number of global training samples per MapReduce iteration

fields.name: use_all_factor_levels
fields.title: Use all factor levels
fields.description: Specify whether to use all factor levels in the possible set of predictors

fields.name: variable_importances
fields.title: Variable importances
fields.description: Specify whether to compute variable importance

nodes.name: PrintNRows
nodes.description: Prints the specified number of records in the DataFrame. It is useful for seeing intermediate output

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: n
fields.title: Num Rows to Print
fields.description: number of rows to be printed

fields.name: displayDataType
fields.title: Display Data Type
fields.description: If true display rows DataType

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: isTestData
fields.title: isTestData
fields.description: To enable the test metrics.

nodes.name: StickyNote
nodes.description: Allows capturing Notes on the Workflow

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: bgColor
fields.title: Bg Color
fields.description: Background of note

fields.name: width
fields.title: Width
fields.description: Width of note

fields.name: height
fields.title: Height
fields.description: Height of note

fields.name: comment
fields.value: Autoencoders is an unsupervised Neural Network. It is a data compression algorithm which takes the input and going through a compressed representation and gives the reconstructed output.
fields.title: Comment
fields.description: Comments for the Workflow
